modifiers.name: Easy to hit
modifiers.notes: Others can target your eyes at -6

5f10acf3-8205-4194-80ad-f76b63ef867d.name: Absent-Mindedness
5f10acf3-8205-4194-80ad-f76b63ef867d.notes: Once adrift in your own thoughts, you must roll against Perception-5 in order to notice any event short of personal physical injury

a47241c6-a068-43a9-b20a-5c9e597fe73a.name: Acrophobia (Heights)
a47241c6-a068-43a9-b20a-5c9e597fe73a.notes: You may not voluntarily go more than 15 feet above ground, unless you are inside a building and away from windows. If there is some chance of an actual fall, self-control rolls are at -5.

71f9755b-9533-4c3c-8b34-7fedcca8d89c.name: Agoraphobia (Open Spaces)
71f9755b-9533-4c3c-8b34-7fedcca8d89c.notes: You are uncomfortable whenever you are outside, and actually become frightened when there are no walls within 50 feet.

636f6575-dfa3-4c4f-b12e-0411c5f43c30.name: Aichmophobia/TL5- (Sharp Things)
636f6575-dfa3-4c4f-b12e-0411c5f43c30.notes: You are afraid of anything pointed. Swords, spears, knives, and needles all give you fits. Trying to use a sharp weapon, or being threatened with one, requires a self-control roll at -2.

b9683d47-9443-4f84-8deb-ea95b418d3c6.name: Aichmophobia/TL6+ (Sharp Things)
b9683d47-9443-4f84-8deb-ea95b418d3c6.notes: You are afraid of anything pointed. Swords, spears, knives, and needles all give you fits. Trying to use a sharp weapon, or being threatened with one, requires a self-control roll at -2.

d3f937d8-f6d1-47d8-bb62-f3aaad0d6285.name: Ailurophobia (Cats)
d3f937d8-f6d1-47d8-bb62-f3aaad0d6285.notes: This includes all felines: lions, tigers, panthers, etc.

modifiers.name: Absorptive Change
modifiers.notes: @Level of Absorptive Change. 1 None, 2, Light, 3, Medium, 4, Heavy, 5, Extra Heavy@

modifiers.name: Off-the-Shelf Looks
modifiers.notes: Halves the usual reaction bonus - adjust manually

45d282f6-7671-459b-8e87-97d8df4736b9.name: Arm ST
45d282f6-7671-459b-8e87-97d8df4736b9.notes: Only applies to efforts to lift, throw, or attack with those arms or hands. If a task requires multiple hands and they don't have the same ST, use the average ST.

c95bf369-12ff-4013-852d-81925f29e6ae.name: Autophobia (Being Alone)
c95bf369-12ff-4013-852d-81925f29e6ae.notes: You cannot stand to be alone, and do anything in your power to avoid it.

71c70fd8-6917-4038-8131-7c7370ecdbbe.name: Bad Back
71c70fd8-6917-4038-8131-7c7370ecdbbe.notes: Throw out your back whenever you make a ST roll, and whenever you roll 17 or 18 on an attack or defense roll in melee combat, or on a roll for an “athletic” skill such as Acrobatics, make a HT roll as well

modifiers.name: People Affected
modifiers.notes: Almost everyone except @large class of people@

e8a65836-d72c-452f-a8d4-fdb7d68aa745.name: Bad Sight (Nearsighted)
e8a65836-d72c-452f-a8d4-fdb7d68aa745.notes: Double actual distance to the target when calculating the range modifier for ranged attacks

6faaf511-d782-4997-a535-b7469dfd35bd.name: Berserk
6faaf511-d782-4997-a535-b7469dfd35bd.notes: Make a self-control roll any time you suffer damage over 1/4 your HP in the space of one second, and whenever you witness equivalent harm to a loved one

modifiers.name: Only Damaged by @1. Choose one from Burning/Corrosion/Cutting/Crushing@ or @2. Choose one from Burning/Corrosion/Cutting/Crushing@
Only Damaged by @1. Choose one from Burning/Corrosion/Cutting/Crushing@, @2. Choose one from Burning/Corrosion/Cutting/Crushing@ or @3. Choose one from Burning/Corrosion/Cutting/Crushing@

bc9fe5de-5ea0-4b35-85b1-30fe4c51e3ed.name: Bloodlust
bc9fe5de-5ea0-4b35-85b1-30fe4c51e3ed.notes: You must make a self-control roll whenever you need to accept a surrender, evade a sentry, take a prisoner, etc.

e7d50a59-49bb-4875-a369-a06d2f3fdd79.name: Brontophobia (Loud Noises)
e7d50a59-49bb-4875-a369-a06d2f3fdd79.notes: You avoid any situation where loud noises are likely. A sudden loud noise requires an immediate self-control roll. A thunderstorm is a traumatic experience for you!

024c8d37-55ac-49ba-bce2-65168846d5a3.name: Charitable
024c8d37-55ac-49ba-bce2-65168846d5a3.notes: Make a self-control roll in any situation where you could render aid or are specifically asked for help, but should resist the urge

2ae950d5-118d-4bb9-aab6-c163cc413217.name: Chronic Depression
2ae950d5-118d-4bb9-aab6-c163cc413217.notes: Make a self-control roll to do anything but acquire and consume the minimum necessities for survival, or whenever you must choose between two or more actions

modifiers.name: Mild
modifiers.notes: -2 to DX, IQ, and self-control rolls

modifiers.name: Severe
modifiers.notes: -4 to DX, IQ, and self-control rolls

modifiers.name: Agonizing
modifiers.notes: -6 to DX, IQ, and self-control rolls

modifiers.name: Projection
modifiers.notes: Can use abilities on material world

59a18fe3-13f2-4fca-a0f8-b1813a0686dd.name: Claustrophobia (Enclosed Spaces)
59a18fe3-13f2-4fca-a0f8-b1813a0686dd.notes: You are uncomfortable any time you can’t see the sky – or at least a very high ceiling. In a small room or vehicle, you feel the walls closing in on you... You need air! This is a dangerous fear for someone who plans to go underground.

b1c4d1e3-81ea-4b84-9d90-221de11b83b8.name: Code of Honor (Chivalry)
b1c4d1e3-81ea-4b84-9d90-221de11b83b8.notes: Protect any lady, and anyone weaker than yourself. Never break your word. Never ignore an insult to yourself, a lady, your liege-lord, or your faith; insults may only be wiped out by an apology or a duel (not necessarily to the death!). Never take advantage of an opponent in any way; weapons and circumstances must be equal (even in open war if the foe is also noble and chivalrous). Accept any challenge to arms from anyone of greater or equal rank.

9f74cca6-0d99-4b16-89b1-3ac3122fbf80.name: Code of Honor (Gentleman's)
9f74cca6-0d99-4b16-89b1-3ac3122fbf80.notes: Never break your word. Never ignore an insult to yourself, a lady, or your flag; insults may only be wiped out by an apology or a duel (not necessarily to the death!). Never take advantage of an opponent in any way; weapons and circumstances must be equal (except in open war). This only applies between gentlemen.

4334f76e-8ed1-4f1a-b9bb-0a626acb5b7a.name: Code of Honor (Pirate's)
4334f76e-8ed1-4f1a-b9bb-0a626acb5b7a.notes: Always avenge an insult, regardless of the danger; your buddy’s foe is your own; never attack a fellow crewman or buddy except in a fair, open duel.

be5292c1-f73b-487f-a31c-1231e69f9e48.name: Code of Honor (Professional)
be5292c1-f73b-487f-a31c-1231e69f9e48.notes: Adhere to the ethics of your profession; always do your job to the best of your ability; support your guild, union, or professional association.

a2be5cfc-59b7-4106-a492-221b15e4491c.name: Code of Honor (Soldier's)
a2be5cfc-59b7-4106-a492-221b15e4491c.notes: An officer should be tough but fair, lead from the front, and look out for his men; an enlisted man should look out for his buddies and take care of his kit. Every soldier should be willing to fight and die for the honor of his unit, service, and country; follow orders; obey the “rules of war”; treat an honorable enemy with respect (a dishonorable enemy deserves a bullet); and wear the uniform with pride.

319dbe98-c847-4d23-b4ef-517f72b68d25.name: Coitophobia (Sex)
319dbe98-c847-4d23-b4ef-517f72b68d25.notes: You are terrified by the idea of sexual relations or the loss of your virginity.

66a5b4a2-29be-47a3-a1b9-c8a14e6922c0.name: Combat Paralysis
66a5b4a2-29be-47a3-a1b9-c8a14e6922c0.notes: In any situation in which personal harm seems imminent, make a HT roll. Do not roll until the instant you need to fight, run, pull the trigger, or whatever. Any roll over 13 is a failure, even if you have HT 14+. On a success, you can act normally. On a failure, you are mentally stunned.

968817d3-5ba1-4b9e-8fd2-f98610042450.name: Confused
968817d3-5ba1-4b9e-8fd2-f98610042450.notes: In a strange place, or when there’s a commotion going on, you must make a self-control roll

74d5f4fe-8e89-4fb8-bf1f-47be8daad1e2.name: Constriction Attack
74d5f4fe-8e89-4fb8-bf1f-47be8daad1e2.notes: If you succeed on a grapple against an opponent no larger than your own SM, on your next turn, and each successive turn, roll a Quick Contest of your ST vs. your victim’s ST or HT, whichever is higher. If you win, your victim takes damage equal to your margin of victory; otherwise, no damage is inflicted

modifiers.name: Can obtain information using supernatural talents

3535400e-1e85-4428-91ea-a933f8637332.name: Cowardice
3535400e-1e85-4428-91ea-a933f8637332.notes: Make a self-control roll any time you are called on to risk physical danger. Roll at -5 if you must risk death.

e8bfbdc6-b47c-470a-a80c-fe4574662193.name: Cultural Familiarity (@Culture@)
e8bfbdc6-b47c-470a-a80c-fe4574662193.notes: Do not suffer the normal -3 penalty for unfamiliarity

b19ec0a6-0ae1-4167-9ae6-1a793b1e2ef2.name: Curious
b19ec0a6-0ae1-4167-9ae6-1a793b1e2ef2.notes: Make a self-control roll when presented with an interesting item or situation

d879da84-cf4e-40e6-8a94-f9c3184537ce.name: Cynophobia (Dogs)
d879da84-cf4e-40e6-8a94-f9c3184537ce.notes: This includes all canines: foxes, wolves, coyotes, wild dogs, etc.

modifiers.name: Directional
modifiers.notes: @Direction: Back, Right, Left, Top or Underside@

modifiers.name: Tough Skin
modifiers.notes: Effects that just require skin contact or a scratch ignore this DR

modifiers.name: Partial (@Location, 1 level per -1 Per Hit Modifier, Torso is -10% thus level 1@)
Can see colors in the dark

ad93731b-6ab5-4a41-ae0b-168cdf6e5ed5.name: Demophobia (Crowds)
ad93731b-6ab5-4a41-ae0b-168cdf6e5ed5.notes: Any group of over a dozen people sets off this fear unless they are all well known to you. The self-control roll is at -1 for over 25 people, -2 for a crowd of 100 or more, -3 for 1,000, -4 for 10,000, and so on.

modifiers.name: Frequency: Constantly
modifiers.notes: Lose 1 HP per minute without it

modifiers.name: Frequency: Hourly
modifiers.notes: Lose 1 HP per 10 minutes after missing a hourly dose

modifiers.name: Frequency: Daily
modifiers.notes: Lose 1 HP per hour after missing a daily dose

modifiers.name: Frequency: Weekly
modifiers.notes: Lose 1 HP per six hours after missing a weekly dose

modifiers.name: Frequency: Monthly
modifiers.notes: Lose 1 HP per day after missing a monthly dose

modifiers.name: Frequency: Seasonally
modifiers.notes: Lose 1 HP per 3 days after missing a seasonal dose

modifiers.name: Frequency: Yearly
modifiers.notes: Lose 1 HP per 2 weeks after missing a yearly dose

modifiers.name: Aging
modifiers.notes: Age 2 years for each HP lost due to this dependency

modifiers.name: Oxygen Storage
modifiers.notes: Can hold breath 25 times as long as normal

modifiers.name: Oxygen Storage
modifiers.notes: Can hold breath 50 times as long as normal

modifiers.name: Oxygen Storage
modifiers.notes: Can hold breath 100 times as long as normal

modifiers.name: Oxygen Storage
modifiers.notes: Can hold breath 200 times as long as normal

modifiers.name: Oxygen Storage
modifiers.notes: Can hold breath 300 times as long as normal

03fe2b6c-9fe3-4685-b568-cbc2de72c44b.name: Dread
03fe2b6c-9fe3-4685-b568-cbc2de72c44b.notes: May not come within level yards of @What@

aff5cc76-af5a-48a0-b293-4df0c8e1206b.name: Dyslexia
aff5cc76-af5a-48a0-b293-4df0c8e1206b.notes: You have a written comprehension level of "None" for all languages, which cannot be improved

bdd03b24-27af-406c-9d91-1a6354ca2489.name: Enhanced Move (@type@)
bdd03b24-27af-406c-9d91-1a6354ca2489.notes: Double your normal @type@ Move for each level

3ab3121b-372e-44da-bde6-14588183a155.name: Enhanced Time Sense
3ab3121b-372e-44da-bde6-14588183a155.notes: You immediately act in combat before those without Enhanced Time Sense; Never freeze

317da0b6-4914-4d51-9a00-2a54d43782d0.name: Entomophobia (Insects)
317da0b6-4914-4d51-9a00-2a54d43782d0.notes: You are afraid of all “bugs.” Large or poisonous ones give -3 to self-control rolls. Very large ones, or large numbers, give -6. Avoid hills of giant ants.

81842e23-cfbd-47d7-bf57-477ca64e055d.name: Epilepsy
81842e23-cfbd-47d7-bf57-477ca64e055d.notes: Make a HT roll whenever you are in a stressful situation (especially if your life or the life of a friend is threatened). If you have any sort of Phobia, exposure to the object of your fear counts as a stressful situation; roll vs. HT once every 10 minutes. On a failure, you suffer a seizure that lasts 1d minutes and costs you 1d FP. You can do nothing during that time.

5ad9c2bd-fe8e-4c7a-9fba-96b8c0837b60.name: Extra Sleep
5ad9c2bd-fe8e-4c7a-9fba-96b8c0837b60.notes: Require 1 hour/level more sleep for a full night's rest (max 4)

9a28293b-1ccc-4cfb-8c86-d78cde3342a8.name: Extraordinary Luck
9a28293b-1ccc-4cfb-8c86-d78cde3342a8.notes: Usable once per 30 minutes of play

modifiers.name: Game Time
modifiers.notes: Uses per game day equal to its maximum possible uses per real hour

30963b5e-c943-4f40-9521-bf181e7f207f.name: Fit
30963b5e-c943-4f40-9521-bf181e7f207f.notes: Recover FP at twice the normal rate (but not FP spent for spells or psi powers)

6e5526d2-66ae-4d7a-918a-7838e1478477.name: Flashbacks
6e5526d2-66ae-4d7a-918a-7838e1478477.notes: In any situation that the GM feels is stressful, he will roll 3d. On a 6 or less, you have a flashback. The GM will roll whenever you miss a Fright Check or make the roll exactly, and whenever you fail a self-control roll for another stress-related disadvantage.

modifiers.name: Mild
modifiers.notes: Duration: 2d seconds; -2 on all skill rolls

modifiers.name: Severe
modifiers.notes: Duration: 1d minutes; -5 on all skill rolls

modifiers.name: Crippling
modifiers.notes: Duration: 3d minutes; Precludes all skill use

e12493bf-51f3-4f78-baad-714d3d34b535.name: Flight
e12493bf-51f3-4f78-baad-714d3d34b535.notes: Air Move is Basic Speed x 2 (drop all fractions)

modifiers.name: Encumbrance-Limited (No encumbrance)
modifiers.notes: Can only glide at best when overburdened

modifiers.name: Encumbrance-Limited (Light encumbrance)
modifiers.notes: Can only glide at best when overburdened

modifiers.name: Encumbrance-Limited (Medium encumbrance)
modifiers.notes: Can only glide at best when overburdened

cc574fa7-dc7b-48ce-b59b-364188e13da5.name: Fragile (Unnatural)
cc574fa7-dc7b-48ce-b59b-364188e13da5.notes: Automatically fail HT roll to stay alive if reduced to -HP or below

8dfb17db-1a7f-49f5-af74-38ced79d3875.name: Gluttony
8dfb17db-1a7f-49f5-af74-38ced79d3875.notes: Make a self-control roll when presented with a tempting morsel or good wine that, for some reason, you should resist. If you fail, you partake – regardless of the consequences.

modifiers.name: People Affected
modifiers.notes: Almost everyone except @large class of people@

b7a0c1db-f40a-471a-857f-e0c88e218d72.name: Greed
b7a0c1db-f40a-471a-857f-e0c88e218d72.notes: Make a self-control roll any time riches are offered – as payment for fair work, gains from adventure, spoils of crime, or just bait. If you fail, you do whatever it takes to get the payoff.

cc26a06d-bfba-49ca-89c5-8c3fcf6065da.name: Hemophilia
cc26a06d-bfba-49ca-89c5-8c3fcf6065da.notes: Any untreated wound bleeds at a rate equal to its original damage every minute

9b27ce82-e114-49b2-be3d-58d78c5a7d8c.name: Hemophobia (Blood)
9b27ce82-e114-49b2-be3d-58d78c5a7d8c.notes: The sight of blood gives you the screaming willies! You need to make a self-control roll during most combats...

30b83f35-7eeb-43c9-8962-34f45e04dbf3.name: Heroic Feats of @One of Strength, Dexterity, or Health@
30b83f35-7eeb-43c9-8962-34f45e04dbf3.notes: Once per game session, you may add 1d to @One of Strength, Dexterity, or Health@, which lasts 3d seconds

bdc9cc1a-6b8b-48ad-9833-ddf7fea97392.name: Herpetophobia (Reptiles)
bdc9cc1a-6b8b-48ad-9833-ddf7fea97392.notes: You come unglued at the thought of reptiles, amphibians, and similar scaly slimies. A very large reptile, or a poisonous one, gives -2 to self-control rolls; a horde of reptiles (such as a snake pit) gives -4.

c603ba10-9788-4c71-967e-be6c089b0bd2.name: High Pain Threshold
c603ba10-9788-4c71-967e-be6c089b0bd2.notes: Never suffer shock penalties when injured

e9b12a42-c2b7-436e-9752-75438eebbb44.name: Honesty
e9b12a42-c2b7-436e-9752-75438eebbb44.notes: Make a self-control roll when faced with the “need” to break unreasonable laws; if you fail, you must obey the law, whatever the consequences. If you manage to resist your urges and break the law, make a second self-control roll afterward. If you fail, you must turn yourself in to the authorities!

d642a33f-906b-438d-9836-c104cc77823e.name: Hoplophobia (Weapons)
d642a33f-906b-438d-9836-c104cc77823e.notes: The presence of any sort of weaponry is stressful. Trying to use a weapon, or being threatened with one, requires a self-control roll at -2.

modifiers.name: DX penalty if not wearing custom-made clothing and armor
modifiers.notes: Clothing and armor costs 10% more than usual

96247355-0a89-4ae0-a89e-be3a97d31591.name: Impulsiveness
96247355-0a89-4ae0-a89e-be3a97d31591.notes: Make a self-control roll whenever it would be wise to wait and ponder. If you fail, you must act

e9f8bb20-c5f2-4d2e-aa84-c51e2694e999.name: Incompetence (@Skill@)
e9f8bb20-c5f2-4d2e-aa84-c51e2694e999.notes: May only know @Skill@ at default (i.e. no points spent)

672f266f-4e98-4e9f-91ef-ffc64b4d2d82.name: Incurious
672f266f-4e98-4e9f-91ef-ffc64b4d2d82.notes: Make a self-control roll when confronted with something strange. If you fail, you ignore it!

300f1f8c-dec7-48d6-affb-01f0a2da82cb.name: Indecisive
300f1f8c-dec7-48d6-affb-01f0a2da82cb.notes: Make a self-control roll whenever a choice confronts you, modified downward by 1 for each alternative you can see. If you fail, you do nothing.

ac22577e-4f37-48ca-8304-1c3d27211231.name: Indomitable
ac22577e-4f37-48ca-8304-1c3d27211231.notes: Impossible to influence through ordinary words or actions

modifiers.name: Diffuse
modifiers.notes: Immune to crippling injuries. Brain, Vitals and Groin cannot be targeted. Most foes cannot slam or grapple you (GM's decision). Do not bleed. Unaffected by blood-borne toxins. Immune to attacks that rely on cutting off blood to part of your body. Impaling and piercing attacks of any size never do more than 1 HP of injury, regardless of penetrating damage. Other attacks never do more than 2 HP of injury. Exception: Area-effect, cone, and explosion attacks cause normal injury

modifiers.name: Homogenous
modifiers.notes: Altered wound modifiers: imp & pi++ are x1/2, pi+ is x1/3, pi is x1/5, pi- is x1/10

modifiers.name: No Blood
modifiers.notes: Do not bleed, unaffected by blood-borne toxins, immune to attacks that rely on cutting off blood to part of your body

modifiers.name: No Brain
modifiers.notes: Brain cannot be targeted. Blows to the skull or eye are treated like blows to the face, except that eye injury can still cripple the eye

modifiers.name: No Eyes
modifiers.notes: Eyes may not be targeted. Immune to blinding attacks

modifiers.name: No Head
modifiers.notes: Skull, Brain and Face cannot be targeted

modifiers.name: No Neck
modifiers.notes: Neck may not be targeted and cannot be decapitated, choked or strangled

modifiers.name: No Vitals
modifiers.notes: Attacks to the Vitals or Groin are treated as attacks to the Torso

modifiers.name: Unliving
modifiers.notes: Altered wound modifiers: imp & pi++ are x1, pi+ is x1/2, pi is x1/3, pi- is x1/5

modifiers.name: Mild
modifiers.notes: GM secretly rolls 3d for the number of days between episodes

modifiers.name: Severe
modifiers.notes: GM secretly rolls 2d-1 for the number of days between episodes

modifiers.name: Partial Change
modifiers.notes: Can turn an item you are carrying substantial without dropping it

07a0d324-5b26-4092-b96f-2d0541b6397f.name: Intolerance (@Class, Ethnicity, Nationality, Religion, Sex, or Species@)

modifiers.name: Usually On
modifiers.notes: Turning visible costs 1 FP per second

81d4e9b6-70b3-4df3-87ed-5b3ccd04b32e.name: Kleptomania
81d4e9b6-70b3-4df3-87ed-5b3ccd04b32e.notes: Make a self-control roll whenever you are presented with a chance to steal, at up to -3 if the item is especially interesting to you (not necessarily valuable, unless you are poor or have Greed). If you fail, you must try to steal it. You may keep or sell stolen items, but you may not return or discard them.

f7d80f66-a36e-42f9-8735-c76281c73754.name: Lame (Crippled Legs)
f7d80f66-a36e-42f9-8735-c76281c73754.notes: You must reduce your Basic Move to half your Basic Speed (round down)

7e593de2-7e62-4a95-bc01-ba98f97a502b.name: Lame (Legless)
7e593de2-7e62-4a95-bc01-ba98f97a502b.notes: You cannot stand, kick, or walk at all and must reduce Basic Move to 0.

9457a14e-e870-4d0f-a2c6-73fa6d862d31.name: Lame (Missing Legs)
9457a14e-e870-4d0f-a2c6-73fa6d862d31.notes: Using crutches or a peg leg, you can stand up and walk slowly. You must reduce Basic Move to 2.

512fde79-d6fa-4a92-a091-1b6f6007a0c9.name: Lame (Paraplegic)
512fde79-d6fa-4a92-a091-1b6f6007a0c9.notes: You cannot stand, kick, or walk at all and must reduce Basic Move to 0.

ec9ed4f8-e647-451c-8300-a36ac0c71f86.name: Laziness
ec9ed4f8-e647-451c-8300-a36ac0c71f86.notes: Your chances of getting a raise or promotion in any job are halved. If you are self-employed, halve your monthly pay.

2d8df8e4-960b-4884-98ed-4cbaee294e68.name: Lecherousness
2d8df8e4-960b-4884-98ed-4cbaee294e68.notes: Make a self-control roll whenever you have more than the briefest contact with an appealing member of the sex you find attractive, at -5 if this person is Handsome/Beautiful, or at -10 if Very Handsome/Very Beautiful. If you fail, you must make a “pass” using whatever wiles and skills you can bring to bear.

5867f5cb-1be1-446d-b978-4c552109ceb0.name: Less Sleep
5867f5cb-1be1-446d-b978-4c552109ceb0.notes: Require 1 hour/level less sleep for a full night's rest (max 4)

modifiers.name: Know Your Own Strength Variant Price

1974b472-b15a-4bf0-b418-7ae5a47623ae.name: Light Sleeper
1974b472-b15a-4bf0-b418-7ae5a47623ae.notes: Whenever you must sleep in an uncomfortable place, or whenever there is more than the slightest noise, you must make a HT roll in order to fall asleep. On a failure, you can try again after one hour, but you will suffer all the usual effects of one hour of missed sleep.

c174f7ea-e6df-45c2-a0fd-848b32b0470b.name: Loner
c174f7ea-e6df-45c2-a0fd-848b32b0470b.notes: Make a self-control roll whenever anyone lingers nearby, watches over your shoulder, etc. If you fail, you lash out at that person just as if you had Bad Temper.

717b2637-c138-4bee-b3ad-e9f21bc1d32a.name: Longevity
717b2637-c138-4bee-b3ad-e9f21bc1d32a.notes: You fail aging rolls only on a 17 or 18, or only on an 18 if your modified HT is 17 or better

526c7704-5563-4822-860f-ada8eb9ee43b.name: Low Pain Threshold
526c7704-5563-4822-860f-ada8eb9ee43b.notes: Double the shock from any injury. Whenever you take a wound that does more than 1 HP of damage, you must make a Will roll to avoid crying out.

8a8229a8-02d0-4943-bdff-81099e0b00e9.name: Luck
8a8229a8-02d0-4943-bdff-81099e0b00e9.notes: Usable once per hour of play

modifiers.name: Game Time
modifiers.notes: Uses per game day equal to its maximum possible uses per real hour

c5d785d4-3f98-4d31-ad20-7f5a48cd543e.name: Lunacy
c5d785d4-3f98-4d31-ad20-7f5a48cd543e.notes: During the full moon, you are extremely emotional and volatile, while on nights of the new moon you are very passive (you temporarily suffer from the Laziness disadvantage, B142). While the moon is waxing, you are focused and pleasant; while it is waning, you are apathetic and a little touchy.

modifiers.name: Frequency: Three to five times daily

8031bfc2-02a5-437b-957e-e95f7893fe8d.name: Manaphobia (Magic)
8031bfc2-02a5-437b-957e-e95f7893fe8d.notes: You can never learn to use magic, and you react badly to any user of magic. Make a self-control roll whenever you are in the presence of magic. This roll is at -3 if you are to be the target of friendly magic, and -6 if you are the target of hostile magic. (The magic does not have to be real, if you believe in it!)

1b1a221e-c7ba-4ee2-b4d4-bef2e7453854.name: Manic-Depressive
1b1a221e-c7ba-4ee2-b4d4-bef2e7453854.notes: At the beginning of each play session, roll 1d. On 1-3, you are in your manic phase; 4-6 indicates depression. Every five hours of game time thereafter, roll 3d. A 10 or less indicates that you begin a mood swing. Over the next hour, you shift from your current phase to the opposite one. You remain in the new phase for at least five hours, after which you must again roll 3d.

1f853f40-c0cd-4382-a568-af9b4a6ab75f.name: Mild Shyness
1f853f40-c0cd-4382-a568-af9b4a6ab75f.notes: You are uneasy with strangers, especially assertive or attractive ones.

83db6733-8724-4d49-b0ff-57ad539e386f.name: Miserliness
83db6733-8724-4d49-b0ff-57ad539e386f.notes: Make a self-control roll any time you are called on to spend money. If the expenditure is large, this roll may be at -5 or worse (GM’s decision). If you fail, you refuse to spend the money.

modifiers.name: Focus-Limited (@Any ordinary variety of matter or energy@)
Focus-Limited (@Any ordinary variety of matter or energy@)
Focus-Limited (@Any ordinary variety of matter or energy@)
Focus-Limited (@Any ordinary variety of matter or energy@)

e56ec21e-3b8a-4ecf-b320-52a4add3ffaf.name: Motion Sickness
e56ec21e-3b8a-4ecf-b320-52a4add3ffaf.notes: You may never learn any vehicle-operation skill. You must roll vs. HT as soon as you are aboard a moving vehicle. On a failure, you vomit and are at -5 on all DX, IQ, and skill rolls for the rest of the journey. On a success, you are merely miserably queasy and at -2 on DX, IQ, and skill rolls. Roll daily on long journeys.

348d7427-9bad-4c6e-9cb7-93172befd909.name: Mysophobia (Dirt)
348d7427-9bad-4c6e-9cb7-93172befd909.notes: You are deathly afraid of infection, or just of dirt and filth. Make a self-control roll when you must do something that might get you dirty. Roll at -5 to eat any unaccustomed food. You should act as “finicky” as possible.

a7932fac-d0f6-4df5-b796-01d69e9d3154.name: Necrophobia (Death)
a7932fac-d0f6-4df5-b796-01d69e9d3154.notes: You are terrified by the idea of death. Make a self-control roll in the presence of any dead body (animals don’t count, but portions of human bodies do). Roll at -4 if the body is that of someone you know, or -6 if the body is unnaturally animated in some way. A ghost (or apparent ghost) also requires a roll at -6.

11771827-9503-4723-b360-0419b36f5230.name: Night Blindness
11771827-9503-4723-b360-0419b36f5230.notes: If the vision or combat penalty for poor lighting is between -1 and -4 for most people, your penalty is the worse of double the usual penalty or -3. If the usual penalty is -5 or worse, you function as though you were completely blind. If you have Acute Vision, it only applies in situations with no darkness penalty.

a1703adf-db1b-4b76-9671-dca396565847.name: Nightmares
a1703adf-db1b-4b76-9671-dca396565847.notes: Make a self-control roll each morning upon awakening. If you fail, you suffered nightmares; this costs you 1 FP that you can only recover through sleep. On a roll of 17 or 18, you are left shaking, and are at -1 to all skill and Perception rolls for the entire day.

003287fb-bff5-4928-b1c7-384247b620f6.name: No Peripheral Vision
003287fb-bff5-4928-b1c7-384247b620f6.notes: Your arc of vision is a 120° wedge to the front. On a map, your “left” and “right” hexes become “back” hexes – that is, you have three “back” hexes, and get no defense against attacks originating from these hexes!

302b6def-9f0f-48e7-83d4-e58221f952b3.name: Obsession
302b6def-9f0f-48e7-83d4-e58221f952b3.notes: @Goal@; Make a self-control roll whenever it would be wise to deviate from your goal. If you fail, you continue to pursue your Obsession, regardless of the consequences.

38d0c011-b055-44f6-ab8e-befc480f146f.name: On the Edge
38d0c011-b055-44f6-ab8e-befc480f146f.notes: Make a self-control roll whenever you face a life-threatening situation: piloting a burning vehicle, staring down an entire street gang while armed only with a toothbrush, etc. If you fail, you may not back down from the challenge – but you may roll again after every success roll or reaction roll relating to the situation. In combat, make a self-control roll every time you take your turn. If you fail, you must make an All-Out attack or engage in some other kind of near-insane, suicidal behavior.

c9df754d-7002-4516-bf49-52ed2f1950b6.name: One Arm
c9df754d-7002-4516-bf49-52ed2f1950b6.notes: You cannot use two-handed weapons, wield two weapons at once (or a weapon and a shield), or perform any task that requires two arms

6bd3bf15-6a6e-4764-950a-e717d1540fc2.name: One Hand
6bd3bf15-6a6e-4764-950a-e717d1540fc2.notes: You cannot use two-handed weapons, wield two weapons at once (or a weapon and a shield), or perform any task that requires two arms

5e6823d9-f372-4b29-ab16-aea1323df21d.name: Overconfidence
5e6823d9-f372-4b29-ab16-aea1323df21d.notes: You must make a self-control roll any time the GM feels you show an unreasonable degree of caution. If you fail, you must go ahead as though you were able to handle the situation!

02b0051f-766c-4320-bcb4-b67092d53002.name: Pacifism: Cannot Harm Innocents
02b0051f-766c-4320-bcb4-b67092d53002.notes: You may fight – you may even start fights – but you may only use deadly force on a foe that is attempting to do you serious harm. Capture is not “serious harm” unless you are already under penalty of death or have a Code of Honor that would require suicide if captured. You never intentionally do anything that causes, or even threatens to cause, injury to the uninvolved – particularly if they are “ordinary folks.”

3ffb9cc5-3a0c-4eb5-a906-938ef1cb8ccc.name: Pacifism: Cannot Kill
3ffb9cc5-3a0c-4eb5-a906-938ef1cb8ccc.notes: You may fight – you may even start fights – but you may never do anything that seems likely to kill another. This includes abandoning a wounded foe to die “on his own”! You must do your best to keep your companions from killing, too. If you do kill someone (or feel responsible for a death), you immediately suffer a nervous breakdown. Roll 3d and be totally morose and useless for that many days. During this time, you must make a Will roll to offer any sort of violence toward anyone, for any reason.

ced7cf08-a7d9-479e-8f05-3b8ae579e9f7.name: Pacifism: Reluctant Killer
ced7cf08-a7d9-479e-8f05-3b8ae579e9f7.notes: You are psychologically unprepared to kill people. Whenever you make a deadly attack (e.g., with a knife or a gun) against an obvious person whose face is visible to you, you are at -4 to hit and may not Aim. If you cannot see the foe’s face (due to a mask, darkness, or distance, or because you attacked from behind), the penalty is only -2, save in close combat. You have no penalty to attack a vehicle (even an occupied one), an opponent you do not believe is a person (including things with Horrific or Monstrous appearance), or a target you can’t actually see (e.g., a set of map coordinates or a blip on a radar screen). If you kill a recognizable person, the effect on you is the same as for Pacifism: Cannot Kill. You have no problem with your allies killing; you may even supply ammo, loaded weapons, and encouragement! You just can’t do the killing yourself.

b70003ce-071b-48a3-bfc4-41513d9ba055.name: Pacifism: Self-Defense Only
b70003ce-071b-48a3-bfc4-41513d9ba055.notes: You only fight to defend yourself or those in your care, using only as much force as necessary (no pre-emptive strikes allowed!). You must do your best to discourage others from starting fights.

b65dc36e-e0c4-4f54-a345-7bdd7d552e1d.name: Pacifism: Total Nonviolence
b65dc36e-e0c4-4f54-a345-7bdd7d552e1d.notes: You will not lift a hand against another intelligent creature, for any reason. You must do your nonviolent best to discourage violent behavior in others, too. You are free to defend yourself against attacks by animals, mosquitoes, etc.

modifiers.name: @Who: Individual with 150% of PC's starting points@
@Who: Organization with assets of at least 1000 times starting wealth@
@Who: Individual with twice the PC's starting points@
@Who: Organization with assets of at least 10000 times starting wealth@
@Who: Organization with assets of at least 100000 times starting wealth@
@Who: Organization with assets of at least 1000000 times starting wealth@
@Who: A national government or giant multi-national organization@
Equipment
modifiers.notes: @Equipment worth no more than average starting wealth@

modifiers.name: Equipment
modifiers.notes: @Equipment worth more than average starting wealth@

modifiers.name: Special Abilities
modifiers.notes: @Magical powers in a non-magical world, higher TL equipment, grants special powers or is supernatural@

modifiers.name: Easy to Hit
modifiers.notes: Others can target your eyes at only -6 to hit

modifiers.name: @Very Common Substance: Earth, Metal, Stone, Wood, etc.@
@Occasional Substance: Glass, Ice, Sand, Aluminum, Copper, etc.@

b61938dd-4a19-46b5-b4e9-fd76a686af6f.name: Phantom Voices
b61938dd-4a19-46b5-b4e9-fd76a686af6f.notes: In any situation that the GM feels is stressful, he may roll 3d. On a 6 or less, you hear voices. The GM will always roll whenever you miss a Fright Check or make the roll exactly, and whenever you fail a self-control roll for another stress-related disadvantage.

d32cbfce-3995-4c4c-982c-4c06bdd2841f.name: Post-Combat Shakes
d32cbfce-3995-4c4c-982c-4c06bdd2841f.notes: Make a self-control roll at the end of any battle. If you fail, roll 3d, add the amount by which you failed your self-control roll, and look up the result on the Fright Check Table.

modifiers.name: Dreaming
modifiers.notes: Combined with Active Only or Can't See Own Death

c5d96a85-b000-4d52-b879-44dc004dd46a.name: Pyromania
c5d96a85-b000-4d52-b879-44dc004dd46a.notes: Make a self-control roll whenever you have an opportunity to set a fire

6a5038f2-5373-4f1f-bdd9-c4f56add9911.name: Pyrophobia (Fire)
6a5038f2-5373-4f1f-bdd9-c4f56add9911.notes: Even a burning cigarette bothers you if it comes within five yards.

66480aa1-c7b4-4180-83ab-ea636a639f5a.name: Racial Skill Bonus - @Skill without a specialization@

fef0847f-778b-424b-af24-9ac92644d056.name: Recovery
fef0847f-778b-424b-af24-9ac92644d056.notes: When determining the length of time you remain unconscious for any reason, divide all times by 60

modifiers.name: @Rare: Acceleration, Altitude Sickness, Bends, Seasickness, Space Sickness, Nanomachines, etc.@
+8 to all HT rolls to resist
+3 to all HT rolls to resist

a7d015f8-288b-484f-a994-0ce4e99685d1.name: Ridiculous Luck
a7d015f8-288b-484f-a994-0ce4e99685d1.notes: Usable once per 10 minutes of play

modifiers.name: Game Time
modifiers.notes: Uses per game day equal to its maximum possible uses per real hour

df032bee-e6c8-413f-8c4a-09d5b69ab597.name: Sadism
df032bee-e6c8-413f-8c4a-09d5b69ab597.notes: Make a self-control roll whenever you have an opportunity to indulge your desires and know you shouldn’t (e.g., because the prisoner is one who should be released unharmed). If you fail, you cannot restrain yourself.

5767618e-0afa-4e7b-99e9-b59cebd35b9d.name: Scotophobia (Darkness)
5767618e-0afa-4e7b-99e9-b59cebd35b9d.notes: A common fear, but crippling. You should avoid being underground if possible; if something happens to your flashlight or torch, you might well lose your mind before you can relight it.

modifiers.name: Narrow Clearance on a "Need to Know" Basis
Broad Clearance on a "Need to Know" Basis

da92009b-b829-4bfb-b0d4-eb38d528dfe1.name: Selfish
da92009b-b829-4bfb-b0d4-eb38d528dfe1.notes: Make a self-control roll whenever you experience a clear social slight or “snub.” On a failure, you lash out at the offending party just as if you had Bad Temper.

2241b57a-5ca1-4bbe-b8e2-a5e963e1645d.name: Selfless
2241b57a-5ca1-4bbe-b8e2-a5e963e1645d.notes: You must make a self-control roll to put your needs – even survival – before those of someone else.

3afda3c1-dad7-4907-ab78-545555012cd9.name: Semi-Upright
3afda3c1-dad7-4907-ab78-545555012cd9.notes: Moving while upright reduces Move by 40%

modifiers.name: Game Time
modifiers.notes: Uses per game week equal to its maximum possible uses per session

30a7c514-7874-4213-b846-fabe416ba25a.name: Severe Shyness
30a7c514-7874-4213-b846-fabe416ba25a.notes: You are very uncomfortable around strangers, and tend to be quiet even among friends.

modifiers.name: Flawed
modifiers.notes: Only for Morph. Flawed is mutually incompatible with Cosmetic.

modifiers.name: Needs Sample
modifiers.notes: Only for Morph. You must touch the target.

modifiers.name: Needs Sample
modifiers.notes: Only for Morph. You must obtain a drop of blood, hair sample, etc. from the target.

modifiers.name: Needs Sample
modifiers.notes: Only for Morph. You must eat the entire target.

7f2cf801-52ba-459d-bd9a-9f9f84972c00.name: Short Attention Span
7f2cf801-52ba-459d-bd9a-9f9f84972c00.notes: Make a self-control roll whenever you must maintain interest in something for an extended period of time, or whenever a distraction is offered. If you fail, you automatically fail at the task at hand.

f3cb9481-120b-48d0-a4b6-17209c8efdb5.name: Signature Gear
f3cb9481-120b-48d0-a4b6-17209c8efdb5.notes: For equipment normally bought with money, each point gives goods worth up to 50% of the average campaign starting wealth (but never cash).

6e667d81-dd52-4850-8ec0-021a9299adab.name: Silence
6e667d81-dd52-4850-8ec0-021a9299adab.notes: Bonuses help only when hearing is the only sense that can be used to detect you.

dbe3133b-c2d8-4293-a5ed-5cfaebeb8d6c.name: Sleepwalker
dbe3133b-c2d8-4293-a5ed-5cfaebeb8d6c.notes: If sleepwalking would matter during an adventure, the GM will make a self-control roll for you whenever you go to sleep. If you fail, you sleepwalk sometime during the night. You wake up after walking for 1d minutes, or if someone awakens you.

1ffa6e02-b871-47f5-a410-39fe07e457e7.name: Slow Eater
1ffa6e02-b871-47f5-a410-39fe07e457e7.notes: Each meal takes about two hours, as opposed to about ½ hour for most humans. This reduces the time available for study, long tasks, and travel on foot by 4½ hours per day.

c8cfa243-4cf0-4dab-b7ae-a6230ca0a481.name: Social Chameleon
c8cfa243-4cf0-4dab-b7ae-a6230ca0a481.notes: Exempt from reaction penalties due to differences in Rank or Status

ff642b96-33bc-4ab0-9c5d-83dbe2a98e5e.name: Social Disease
ff642b96-33bc-4ab0-9c5d-83dbe2a98e5e.notes: Those who know about it automatically resist your seduction attempts

64c6bcb3-4ab1-457d-8848-51efa5944498.name: Social Stigma (Minor)
64c6bcb3-4ab1-457d-8848-51efa5944498.notes: You are underage by your culture’s standards. You must buy off this trait when you reach “legal age” (usually 18) for your time and place.

1bf8c968-8f91-401a-8990-0eb6938acc38.name: Social Stigma (Minority Group)
1bf8c968-8f91-401a-8990-0eb6938acc38.notes: You are a member of a minority that the dominant culture around you regards as “barbarians” or “inferior.”

b19efc32-c2b4-45e0-9a82-e281145ccb60.name: Social Stigma (Second-Class Citizen)
b19efc32-c2b4-45e0-9a82-e281145ccb60.notes: You belong to a group that receives fewer rights and privileges than “full citizens.”

modifiers.name: Specialized
modifiers.notes: @Type: Angels, Demons, Elementals, Faerie, Ghosts, etc.@

modifiers.name: Know Your Own Strength Pricing Variant

5201cb24-ea82-4d64-9526-b948b8bc997f.name: Super Luck
5201cb24-ea82-4d64-9526-b948b8bc997f.notes: Dictate one die roll once per hour of play

modifiers.name: Game Time
modifiers.notes: Uses per game day equal to its maximum possible uses per real hour

modifiers.name: No Body Heat
modifiers.notes: Gives +1 on all rolls to deduce your secret

modifiers.name: No Body Heat
modifiers.notes: Can gain warmth temporarily, such as after feeding for a vampire. Gives +1 on all rolls to deduce your secret

modifiers.name: No Reflection
modifiers.notes: Gives +2 on all rolls to deduce your secret

modifiers.name: No Shadow
modifiers.notes: Gives +2 on all rolls to deduce your secret

modifiers.name: Pallor
modifiers.notes: Gives +2 on all rolls to deduce your secret

modifiers.name: Pallor
modifiers.notes: Can gain the flush of life temporarily, such as after feeding for a vampire. Gives +2 on all rolls to deduce your secret

modifiers.name: Alternate Benefit
modifiers.notes: Bonus to rolls to survive made by plants in your care.

modifiers.name: Alternate Benefit
modifiers.notes: Bonus to HT rolls for a specific patient and condition if treated full time.

modifiers.name: Alternate Benefit
modifiers.notes: Bonus to HT rolls for a specific patient and condition if treated full time.

modifiers.name: Alternate Benefit
modifiers.notes: Bonus to resist deception involving numbers

modifiers.name: Alternate Benefit
modifiers.notes: Bonus to HT rolls to avoid harm from failure of covered skills

fe80755b-54bf-414d-8544-651327af543f.name: Teratophobia (Monsters)
fe80755b-54bf-414d-8544-651327af543f.notes: Any “unnatural” creature sets off this fear. You have -1 to -4 on the self-control roll if the monster seems very large or dangerous, or if there are a lot of them. Note that the definition of “monster” depends on experience. An American Indian would consider an elephant monstrous, while an African pygmy would not!

450949e8-65f1-4647-901a-8516b1f7cb9e.name: Thalassophobia (Oceans)
450949e8-65f1-4647-901a-8516b1f7cb9e.notes: You are afraid of any large body of water. Ocean travel, or even air travel over the ocean, is basically impossible for you, and encounters with aquatic monsters are also upsetting.

f0840890-38b3-48e6-8059-83d2ac0ab1b2.name: Trickster
f0840890-38b3-48e6-8059-83d2ac0ab1b2.notes: Make a self-control roll each day. If you fail, you must try to trick a dangerous subject: a skilled warrior, a dangerous monster, a whole group of reasonably competent opponents, etc. If you resist, you get a cumulative -1 per day to your self-control roll until you finally fail a roll!

ee2f1e8f-f0e5-42e7-a857-53126a7438bc.name: Triskaidekaphobia (Number 13)
ee2f1e8f-f0e5-42e7-a857-53126a7438bc.notes: You must make a self-control roll whenever you have to deal with the number 13. Roll at -5 if Friday the 13th is involved!

d985b682-25d7-4656-b8e5-d249d7c74add.name: Truthfulness
d985b682-25d7-4656-b8e5-d249d7c74add.notes: Make a self-control roll whenever you must keep silent about an uncomfortable truth (lying by omission). Roll at -5 if you actually have to tell a falsehood! If you fail, you blurt out the truth, or stumble so much that your lie is obvious.

17e61cee-8dc4-458e-8921-091151d79f7f.name: Tunnel Vision
17e61cee-8dc4-458e-8921-091151d79f7f.notes: Your arc of vision is a 60° wedge to the front. On a map, your only “front” hex is the one directly ahead of you. The hexes to either side of this are “side” hexes: you are at -2 to defend against attacks from these hexes, and can only attack into those hexes with a Wild Swing. Everything else is a “back” hex and get no defense against attacks originating from these hexes!

94dc8d8d-b641-4e44-8483-c7a7cb7025d3.name: Unfazeable
94dc8d8d-b641-4e44-8483-c7a7cb7025d3.notes: Exempt from fright checks. Reaction modifiers do not affect you.

4246ef0a-1e5c-4b50-880c-3d864045a8cd.name: Unfit
4246ef0a-1e5c-4b50-880c-3d864045a8cd.notes: You lose FP at twice the normal rate

8403b2c8-c654-4ef3-a219-c249fd72fcd3.name: Unluckiness
8403b2c8-c654-4ef3-a219-c249fd72fcd3.notes: Once per play session, the GM will arbitrarily and maliciously make something go wrong for you.

801fb576-188c-4563-b07a-de39f220273a.name: Vampiric Bite
801fb576-188c-4563-b07a-de39f220273a.notes: Drains 1 HP + 1/level per second. For every 3 HP stolen, you heal 1 HP or 1 FP (your choice). Also lets you bite in combat without feeding. Add Teeth (Sharp Teeth) or Teeth (Sharp Beak) – your choice for free.

47bf0965-9955-40e2-ba36-b52de2542178.name: Very Fit
47bf0965-9955-40e2-ba36-b52de2542178.notes: Recover FP at twice the normal rate; lose FP at half the normal rate (in both cases, not FP spent for spells or psi powers)

82a2b756-32fa-48ef-809d-35b0e81991b0.name: Very Rapid Healing
82a2b756-32fa-48ef-809d-35b0e81991b0.notes: When you roll to recover lost HP, a successful HT roll means you heal 2 HP, not 1

6966e2da-7bda-4aa4-a890-8d19b770af17.name: Very Unfit
6966e2da-7bda-4aa4-a890-8d19b770af17.notes: You lose FP at twice the normal rate and recover FP at only half the normal rate

modifiers.name: Game Time
modifiers.notes: Uses per game week equal to its maximum possible uses per session

adb17f78-15a1-47d8-a4e1-65c011e6bafb.name: Xenophobia (Strange and Unknown Things)
adb17f78-15a1-47d8-a4e1-65c011e6bafb.notes: You are upset by any sort of strange circumstances, and in particular by strange people. Make a self-control roll when surrounded by people of another race or nationality; roll at -3 if the people are not human. If you lose control, you might well attack strangers out of fear.
